summary: Campus-based management system with real-time notifications using Python backend, HTML/CSS/JavaScript frontend, and MySQL database.
architectural_notes: Tech stack: Python backend with HTML/CSS/JavaScript frontend and MySQL database.
Include real-time notification capability (e.g., WebSockets or similar).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Campus management app logo mark, simple geometric + academic motif (campus-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Wide hero banner illustration of a modern university campus scene, minimal flat style (campus-hero.dim_1600x600.png)

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and store a user profile record (principal, display name, optional department/program) that is created on first login and can be updated by the user.
Provide core campus content management for announcements: create, list, view details, and delete announcements, with each announcement containing title, body, author principal, and created timestamp.

Implement a notifications feature backed by announcement activity: when a new announcement is created, add a notification entry (type, reference id, message, created timestamp) and expose APIs to fetch notifications for a user and mark them as read.
Implement near-real-time notification updates on the frontend using polling (no WebSockets): periodically refetch notifications and show an in-app toast/badge when new unread notifications arrive.
Create an initial app navigation and layout for the MVP with pages/sections for: Sign in, Dashboard, Announcements, Notifications, and Profile.
Apply a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, components) appropriate for a campus management app and enforce it consistently across all screens.
Add generated static image assets to the frontend and use them in the UI (e.g., app header/login screen) by serving them from frontend/public/assets/generated.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a campus-based management system with real-time notifications (Python, HTML/CSS/JS, MySQL).

Persist all backend data (profiles, announcements, notifications, read state) in stable structures in the single Motoko actor so data survives canister upgrades (add migration only if required by the template/state handling).
